reviewText: There is a time tested formula for a successful slasher film.  Everyone knows it - a minimalist plot with a subdued back story with hot half naked victims stalked by an unknown killer.  And in every way possible SPIRIT CAMP delivers.  SPIRIT CAMP starts off hot with a half naked cheerleader and bloody when she's killed in the requisite early death scene flashback.  The film then flashes to the "here and now" and tells the story of a group of girls off to "cheer camp" where they are stalked and killed in standard slasher fashion.This not the most brutal slasher filmed recently and does not deliver the hardcore blood and guts kills of say, Rob Hall's LAID TO REST, but the on-scene kills work and the off-scene kill victims are on display later in the film.  Kerry Beyer's low-budget f/x work is effective.The acting is really good.  Most of the cheerleaders are first or second time actors in this film, but they all deliver believable performances.All in all, I enjoyed this film and continue to enjoy it each time I watch it.  It's definitely an example of how much fun you can have with a slasher film without overdoing the campiness to the point of making a bad film.
summary: Funnest slasher film in a long, long time
Title: N/A

reviewText: HIP HIP HOORAY!  Writer/director Kerry Beyer is your new bloody Cheer Captain.  That dude is crazy cool, and so is his latest herkey jerkey homage to old school 80's horror.  For all you slasher/comedy fans, this movie is a solid excuse to avoid doing housework or bathing.  SPIRIT CAMP has to be the best slasher with a short skirt and pom-poms made in the last twenty minutes.So, what's the recipe for a good independent horror film?  Hot naked chicks and lots of blood is usually a wonderful place to start.  The story itself here is pretty standard--a group of diverse, young, and sexy ladies are attending a cheerleader camp.  Along with the pre-menstrual rivalry brewing, there happens to be a homicidal lunatic lurking somewhere neaby.  So eventually the female squad has to unite for survival.This movie has a nice dose of laughs.  Of course, cheerleaders are easy targets to exploit when it comes to comedy, and it honestly never seems to get old..."Can we get tanned by sitting close to the campfire?  The sun really is just a ball of fire, right?"  (groan)Well, these sharp as a spoon ladies eventually make nice targets for an axe-wielding madman.  While they are busy sneaking booze and daydreaming about Mr. Right, the deranged maniac starts to pick them off.  This features some nice old school props and makeup for the kills, which all look fairly gruesome.  Nothing ground-breaking, but still it's some good messy fun.Overall, there isn't really much new ground covered here with Spirit Camp, but hey, if it ain't broke....
summary: Three cheers for the slasher period...on its period! (3.5 stars)
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the funniest slasher film I have ever seen - and it totally made up for the slew of bad comedies I have seen recently."Spirit Camp" is totally a throwback to 1980's horror films like Friday 13th and Sleepaway Camp. If you hate those two films, then don't rent or buy this one. But if you like laughs with your horror films, this one is right up your alley.It basically involves some teenagers who go away to a cheerleading camp in the woods, and murder/sex/drugs et.al occur and hilarity ensues. There are really no surprises, just indie horror at its best. With tons of funny one-liners and just the right amount of blood/gore, this is a film that adds to the genre but does not seem cliche because it doesn't take itself too seriously.What a good time I had watching this film - highly entertaining!

reviewText: This is why I like casts that are unknowns, because people expect nothing frm its actors and actually enjoy it.The obvious: Hot girls ha Julin, Katy Rowe and Megan Moser are stunning, not the best acting in the world, but ok enough to keep my interest.I thought the film would be terrible, but wasn't bad and it began pretty good, with the "hot girls" having a bonfire with the "nerds" instead of the typical jocks. Right off the bat I knew this film would be a tad different and it was. Some "lol" moments, wasn't a bad film. I say give it a shot.

reviewText: Spirit Camp was fun! It's a good Horror/Comedy with a unique style. I think director Kerry Beyer wanted us to have a good time and some good laughs. Some of the scenes were actually directed in a funny/cheesy way but its all good. The movie is still very effective.I first saw this movie under someone else's reviews who also likes horror movies. I immediately saw all those good reviews about it and decided I woud give it a try. To be honest I would say that I was expecting something a little bit more serious, without that comedic tone to it you know, but its ok, I wasn't disappointed and I had a good time watching it. There is lots of funny moments and the killing scenes are nice too.Here's the plot summary from IMDB, It was written by the director Kerry Beyer himself. I thought it was nicely done and would probably save me some time!....lol.......Plus, since SOPA and PIPA might do some serious damage to the free and open internet, I thought I would take advantage of it before its too late....he,he. Here it is : "When a street smart "goth girl" (Roxy Vandiver) is forced to attend cheerleader camp as part of her rehabilitation from a juvenile correction facility, she clashes with the "popular girls," and finds herself embroiled in a bitter rivalry with the bitchy ringleader Rachel (Julin). But when members of the spirit squad start turning up dead, the girls must put aside their differences and struggle to survive the murderous rage of a crazed psycho-killer lurking among them! Written by Kerry BeyerThe cinematography was good, nice picture, great work with the lights and very colourful scenes, even the dark scenes.... The acting was good, sometimes a little cheesy but that goes well with the tone of the movie. Roxy Vandiver was pretty good to. I would recommend it to anyone who wanna have a good time with some friends.This one will go right besides "thankskilling" and "Megapiranha" in my collection. Have fun.....SUE ME!!!!
summary: "Friday the 13th" meets "Bring it On!" - I Guess They Were Right.....

reviewText: I don't think there is anything that I enjoy more in the world than a good "Friday the 13th" ripoff. Well, possibly a bad "Friday the 13th" ripoff but that's a discussion for a different review. Anyway, there is just something about the "Friday the 13th" series that makes it so ripe for parody. The sex equals death equation mixed with creative death scenes and some over-the-top acting usually makes for a good time and it's a recipe that just about any (and just about all) slasher films follow. With that being said, I sat down to watch "Spirit Camp" will little expectations. If a movie tries to be a parody of a slasher film, it usually falls flat. Why is that? Well, the answer is quite simple. Outside of the 1980's, I don't think any adult horror viewer would find anything scary or frightening in a film like "Friday the 13th", it's already close to self parody as it is. Going any further into parody would simply be overkill. With this bias out of the way, can "Spirit Camp" deliver the goods in what is possibly the hardest horror subgenre around? Or does it leaving you wanting more laughs and more scares? Let's dig in."Spirit Camp" begins with a flashback. When a slutty cheerleader is turned down by her obviously gay boyfriend for sex, she returns to camp to find that all of her fellow cheerleading friends have been murdered. One ax to the neck later and we are now in present time, two years later. We find that a street smart "goth girl" (Roxy Vandiver) is forced to attend cheerleader camp as part of her rehabilitation from a juvenile correction facility. She clashes with the "popular girls," and finds herself embroiled in a bitter rivalry with the ringleader Rachel (Julin). No, I'm not missing a last name there, her screen credit is simply "Julin." Maybe she wants to be the next Cher or Madonna but based on her acting here...oh wait, we are talking about Cher and Madonna...yeah, that seems about right. Anyway, when members of the spirit squad start turning up dead, the girls must put aside their differences and struggle to survive the murderous rage of a crazed psycho-killer lurking among them!Sound scary? Well, it's not. Sound funny? That it is. Billed as a "Friday the 13th" meets "Bring it On", the film works because it takes its deaths seriously but places its tongue firming in cheek with everything else. With clever references to other horror movies like "Halloween" (the camp director's name is Miss Haddonfield) and a sly winking to the camera with some outrageous but not too over-the-top death scenes, "Spirit Camp" surprisingly works. Want to see a mean cheer captain get an ax to the face while pleasuring herself with a giant pink vibrator? This is the movie for you. Nothing here is very subtle but for a low budget horror comedy, the deaths are surprisingly well executed and the make up effects on the killer (no, I'm not going to give away who it is besides saying that it is pretty obvious) are top notch. If you are a fan of 80's slashers, you could do a lot worse than this one and you might even get a few quality laughs. For a direct to dvd horror film, that's about the best you can ask for.
Title: N/A
